t: Leviticus 1
And*p the Lord*s called unto Moses, and spake unto him out of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,
Speak*p unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, If any man of you bring an offering unto the Lord,*s ye shall bring your offering of the cattle, even of the herd, and of the flock.

If*p his offering be a burnt sacrifice of the herd, let him offer a male without blemish: he shall offer it of his own voluntary will at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the Lord.*s
And*p he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering; and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.

And*p he shall kill the bullock before the Lord:*s and the priests, Aaron's sons, shall bring the blood, and sprinkle the blood round about upon the altar that is by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into his pieces.
And*p the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar, and lay the wood in order upon the fire:
And*p the priests, Aaron's sons, shall lay the parts, the head, and the fat, in order upon the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar:
But*p his inwards and his legs shall he wash in water: and the priest shall burn all on the altar, to be a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord.*s
And*p if his offering be of the flocks, namely, of the sheep, or of the goats, for a burnt sacrifice; he shall bring it a male without blemish.
And*p he shall kill it on the side of the altar northward before the Lord:*s and the priests, Aaron's sons, shall sprinkle his blood round about upon the altar.
And*p he shall cut it into his pieces, with his head and his fat: and the priest shall lay them in order on the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar:

But*p he shall wash the inwards and the legs with water: and the priest shall bring it all, and burn it upon the altar: it is a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord.*s
And*p if the burnt sacrifice for his offering to the Lord*s be of fowls, then he shall bring his offering of turtledoves, or of young pigeons.
And*p the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and wring off his head, and burn it on the altar; and the blood thereof shall be wrung out at the side of the altar:
And*p he shall pluck away his crop with his feathers, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, by the place of the ashes:

And*p he shall cleave it with the wings thereof, but shall not divide it asunder: and the priest shall burn it upon the altar, upon the wood that is upon the fire: it is a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord.*s
Leviticus 2
And*p when any will offer a grain offering unto the Lord,*s his offering shall be of fine flour; and he shall pour oil upon it, and put frankincense thereon:

And*p he shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests: and he shall take thereout his handful of the flour thereof, and of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar, to be an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord:*s
And*p the remnant of the grain offering shall be Aaron's and his sons': it is a thing most holy of the offerings of the Lord*s made by fire.
And*p if thou bring an oblation of a grain offering baken in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.
And*p if thy oblation be a grain offering baken in a pan, it shall be of fine flour unleavened, mingled with oil.
Thou*p shalt part it in pieces, and pour oil thereon: it is a grain offering.
And*p if thy oblation be a grain offering baken in the fryingpan, it shall be made of fine flour with oil.
And*p thou shalt bring the grain offering that is made of these things unto the Lord:*s and when it is presented unto the priest, he shall bring it unto the altar.
And*p the priest shall take from the grain offering a memorial thereof, and shall burn it upon the altar: it is an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord.*s
And*p that which is left of the grain offering shall be Aaron's and his sons': it is a thing most holy of the offerings of the Lord*s made by fire.
No*p grain offering, which ye shall bring unto the Lord,*s shall be made with leaven: for ye shall burn no leaven, nor any honey, in any offering of the Lord*s made by fire.
As*p for the oblation of the firstfruits, ye shall offer them unto the Lord:*s but they shall not be burnt on the altar for a sweet savour.

And*p every oblation of thy grain offering shalt thou season with salt; neither shalt thou suffer the salt of the covenant of thy God to be lacking from thy grain offering: with all thine offerings thou shalt offer salt.

And*p if thou offer a grain offering of thy firstfruits unto the Lord,*s thou shalt offer for the grain offering of thy firstfruits green ears of corn dried by the fire, even corn beaten out of full ears.
And*p thou shalt put oil upon it, and lay frankincense thereon: it is a grain offering.
And*p the priest shall burn the memorial of it, part of the beaten corn thereof, and part of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof: it is an offering made by fire unto the Lord.*s
Leviticus 3
And*p if his oblation be a sacrifice of peace offering, if he offer it of the herd; whether it be a male or female, he shall offer it without blemish before the Lord.*s

And*p he shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering, and kill it at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron's sons the priests shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.
And*p he shall offer of the sacrifice of the peace offering an offering made by fire unto the Lord;*s the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
And*p the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away.
And*p Aaron's sons shall burn it on the altar upon the burnt sacrifice, which is upon the wood that is on the fire: it is an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord.*s
And*p if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offering unto the Lord*s be of the flock; male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.
If*p he offer a lamb for his offering, then shall he offer it before the Lord.*s
And*p he shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering, and kill it before the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron's sons shall sprinkle the blood thereof round about upon the altar.

And*p he shall offer of the sacrifice of the peace offering an offering made by fire unto the Lord;*s the fat thereof, and the whole rump, it shall he take off hard by the backbone; and the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
And*p the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, which is by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away.
And*p the priest shall burn it upon the altar: it is the food of the offering made by fire unto the Lord.*s
And*p if his offering be a goat, then he shall offer it before the Lord.*s
And*p he shall lay his hand upon the head of it, and kill it before the tabernacle of the congregation: and the sons of Aaron shall sprinkle the blood thereof upon the altar round about.
And*p he shall offer thereof his offering, even an offering made by fire unto the Lord;*s the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
And*p the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, which is by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away.
And*p the priest shall burn them upon the altar: it is the food of the offering made by fire for a sweet savour: all the fat is the Lord's.*s
It*p shall be a perpetual statute for your generations throughout all your dwellings, that ye eat neither fat nor blood.
Leviticus 4
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

Speak*p unto the children of Israel, saying, If a soul shall sin through ignorance against any of the commandments of the Lord*s concerning things which ought not to be done, and shall do against any of them:
If*p the priest that is anointed do sin according to the sin of the people; then let him bring for his sin, which he hath sinned, a young bullock without blemish unto the Lord*s for a sin offering.
And*p he shall bring the bullock unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the Lord;*s and shall lay his hand upon the bullock's head, and kill the bullock before the Lord.*s
And*p the priest that is anointed shall take of the bullock's blood, and bring it to the tabernacle of the congregation:
And*p the priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle of the blood seven times before the Lord,*s before the veil of the sanctuary.

And*p the priest shall put some of the blood upon the horns of the altar of sweet incense before the Lord,*s which is in the tabernacle of the congregation; and shall pour all the blood of the bullock at the bottom of the altar of the burnt offering, which is at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p he shall take off from it all the fat of the bullock for the sin offering; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
And*p the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, which is by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away,
As*p it was taken off from the bullock of the sacrifice of peace offerings: and the priest shall burn them upon the altar of the burnt offering.
And*p the skin of the bullock, and all his flesh, with his head, and with his legs, and his inwards, and his dung,

Even*p the whole bullock shall he carry forth without the camp unto a clean place, where the ashes are poured out, and burn him on the wood with fire: where the ashes are poured out shall he be burnt.

And*p if the whole congregation of Israel sin through ignorance, and the thing be hid from the eyes of the assembly, and they have done somewhat against any of the commandments of the Lord*s concerning things which should not be done, and are guilty;
When*p the sin, which they have sinned against it, is known, then the congregation shall offer a young bullock for the sin, and bring him before the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p the elders of the congregation shall lay their hands upon the head of the bullock before the Lord:*s and the bullock shall be killed before the Lord.*s
And*p the priest that is anointed shall bring of the bullock's blood to the tabernacle of the congregation:
And*p the priest shall dip his finger in some of the blood, and sprinkle it seven times before the Lord,*s even before the veil.

And*p he shall put some of the blood upon the horns of the altar which is before the Lord,*s that is in the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall pour out all the blood at the bottom of the altar of the burnt offering, which is at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p he shall take all his fat from him, and burn it upon the altar.
And*p he shall do with the bullock as he did with the bullock for a sin offering, so shall he do with this: and the priest shall make an atonement for them, and it shall be forgiven them.
And*p he shall carry forth the bullock without the camp, and burn him as he burned the first bullock: it is a sin offering for the congregation.
When*p a ruler hath sinned, and done somewhat through ignorance against any of the commandments of the Lord*s his God concerning things which should not be done, and is guilty;
Or*p if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:
And*p he shall lay his hand upon the head of the goat, and kill it in the place where they kill the burnt offering before the Lord:*s it is a sin offering.

And*p the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, and put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and shall pour out his blood at the bottom of the altar of burnt offering.
And*p he shall burn all his fat upon the altar, as the fat of the sacrifice of peace offerings: and the priest shall make an atonement for him as concerning his sin, and it shall be forgiven him.
And*p if any one of the common people sin through ignorance, while he doeth somewhat against any of the commandments of the Lord*s concerning things which ought not to be done, and be guilty;
Or*p if his sin, which he hath sinned, come to his knowledge: then he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a female without blemish, for his sin which he hath sinned.
And*p he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering, and slay the sin offering in the place of the burnt offering.
And*p the priest shall take of the blood thereof with his finger, and put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and shall pour out all the blood thereof at the bottom of the altar.

And*p he shall take away all the fat thereof, as the fat is taken away from off the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall burn it upon the altar for a sweet savour unto the Lord;*s and the priest shall make an atonement for him, and it shall be forgiven him.
And*p if he bring a lamb for a sin offering, he shall bring it a female without blemish.
And*p he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering, and slay it for a sin offering in the place where they kill the burnt offering.

And*p the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, and put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and shall pour out all the blood thereof at the bottom of the altar:

And*p he shall take away all the fat thereof, as the fat of the lamb is taken away from the sacrifice of the peace offerings; and the priest shall burn them upon the altar, according to the offerings made by fire unto the Lord:*s and the priest shall make an atonement for his sin that he hath committed, and it shall be forgiven him.
Leviticus 5
And*p if a soul sin, and hear the voice of swearing, and is a witness, whether he hath seen or known of it; if he do not utter it, then he shall bear his iniquity.

Or*p if a soul touch any unclean thing, whether it be a carcase of an unclean beast, or a carcase of unclean cattle, or the carcase of unclean creeping things, and if it be hidden from him; he also shall be unclean, and guilty.
Or*p if he touch the uncleanness of man, whatsoever uncleanness it be that a man shall be defiled withal, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth of it, then he shall be guilty.

Or*p if a soul swear, pronouncing with his lips to do evil, or to do good, whatsoever it be that a man shall pronounce with an oath, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth of it, then he shall be guilty in one of these.
And*p it shall be, when he shall be guilty in one of these things, that he shall confess that he hath sinned in that thing:

And*p he shall bring his trespass offering unto the Lord*s for his sin which he hath sinned, a female from the flock, a lamb or a kid of the goats, for a sin offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his sin.

And*p if he be not able to bring a lamb, then he shall bring for his trespass, which he hath committed, two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, unto the Lord;*s one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering.
And*p he shall bring them unto the priest, who shall offer that which is for the sin offering first, and wring off his head from his neck, but shall not divide it asunder:
And*p he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin offering upon the side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be wrung out at the bottom of the altar: it is a sin offering.
And*p he shall offer the second for a burnt offering, according to the manner: and the priest shall make an atonement for him for his sin which he hath sinned, and it shall be forgiven him.

But*p if he be not able to bring two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, then he that sinned shall bring for his offering the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering; he shall put no oil upon it, neither shall he put any frankincense thereon: for it is a sin offering.

Then*p shall he bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take his handful of it, even a memorial thereof, and burn it on the altar, according to the offerings made by fire unto the Lord:*s it is a sin offering.
And*p the priest shall make an atonement for him as touching his sin that he hath sinned in one of these, and it shall be forgiven him: and the remnant shall be the priest's, as a meat offering.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

If*p a soul commit a trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holy things of the Lord;*s then he shall bring for his trespass unto the Lord*s a ram without blemish out of the flocks, with thy estimation by shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering:

And*p he shall make amends for the harm that he hath done in the holy thing, and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering, and it shall be forgiven him.
And*p if a soul sin, and commit any of these things which are forbidden to be done by the commandments of the Lord;*s though he wist it not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity.

And*p he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his ignorance wherein he erred and wist it not, and it shall be forgiven him.
It*p is a trespass offering: he hath certainly trespassed against the Lord.*s
Leviticus 6
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

If*p a soul sin, and commit a trespass against the Lord,*s and lie unto his neighbour in that which was delivered him to keep, or in fellowship, or in a thing taken away by violence, or hath deceived his neighbour;
Or*p have found that which was lost, and lieth concerning it, and sweareth falsely; in any of all these that a man doeth, sinning therein:

Then*p it shall be, because he hath sinned, and is guilty, that he shall restore that which he took violently away, or the thing which he hath deceitfully gotten, or that which was delivered him to keep, or the lost thing which he found,

Or*p all that about which he hath sworn falsely; he shall even restore it in the principal, and shall add the fifth part more thereto, and give it unto him to whom it appertaineth, in the day of his trespass offering.
And*p he shall bring his trespass offering unto the Lord,*s a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest:
And*p the priest shall make an atonement for him before the Lord:*s and it shall be forgiven him for any thing of all that he hath done in trespassing therein.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

Command*p Aaron and his sons, saying, This is the law of the burnt offering: It is the burnt offering, because of the burning upon the altar all night unto the morning, and the fire of the altar shall be burning in it.

And*p the priest shall put on his linen garment, and his linen breeches shall he put upon his flesh, and take up the ashes which the fire hath consumed with the burnt offering on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.
And*p he shall put off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry forth the ashes without the camp unto a clean place.

And*p the fire upon the altar shall be burning in it; it shall not be put out: and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning, and lay the burnt offering in order upon it; and he shall burn thereon the fat of the peace offerings.
The*p fire shall ever be burning upon the altar; it shall never go out.
And*p this is the law of the meat offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before the Lord,*s before the altar.

And*p he shall take of it his handful, of the flour of the meat offering, and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincense which is upon the meat offering, and shall burn it upon the altar for a sweet savour, even the memorial of it, unto the Lord.*s
And*p the remainder thereof shall Aaron and his sons eat: with unleavened bread shall it be eaten in the holy place; in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation they shall eat it.
It*p shall not be baken with leaven. I have given it unto them for their portion of my offerings made by fire; it is most holy, as is the sin offering, and as the trespass offering.

All*p the males among the children of Aaron shall eat of it. It shall be a statute for ever in your generations concerning the offerings of the Lord*s made by fire: every one that toucheth them shall be holy.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

This*p is the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer unto the Lord*s in the day when he is anointed; the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meat offering perpetual, half of it in the morning, and half thereof at night.
In*p a pan it shall be made with oil; and when it is baken, thou shalt bring it in: and the baken pieces of the meat offering shalt thou offer for a sweet savour unto the Lord.*s
And*p the priest of his sons that is anointed in his stead shall offer it: it is a statute for ever unto the Lord;*s it shall be wholly burnt.
For*p every meat offering for the priest shall be wholly burnt: it shall not be eaten.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak*p unto Aaron and to his sons, saying, This is the law of the sin offering: In the place where the burnt offering is killed shall the sin offering be killed before the Lord:*s it is most holy.
The*p priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it: in the holy place shall it be eaten, in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation.
Whatsoever*p shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy: and when there is sprinkled of the blood thereof upon any garment, thou shalt wash that whereon it was sprinkled in the holy place.
But*p the earthen vessel wherein it is sodden shall be broken: and if it be sodden in a brasen pot, it shall be both scoured, and rinsed in water.
All*p the males among the priests shall eat thereof: it is most holy.
And*p no sin offering, whereof any of the blood is brought into the tabernacle of the congregation to reconcile withal in the holy place, shall be eaten: it shall be burnt in the fire.
Leviticus 7
Likewise*p this is the law of the trespass offering: it is most holy.
In*p the place where they kill the burnt offering shall they kill the trespass offering: and the blood thereof shall he sprinkle round about upon the altar.
And*p he shall offer of it all the fat thereof; the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards,
And*p the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the flanks, and the caul that is above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away:
And*p the priest shall burn them upon the altar for an offering made by fire unto the Lord:*s it is a trespass offering.
Every*p male among the priests shall eat thereof: it shall be eaten in the holy place: it is most holy.
As*p the sin offering is, so is the trespass offering: there is one law for them: the priest that maketh atonement therewith shall have it.
And*p the priest that offereth any man's burnt offering, even the priest shall have to himself the skin of the burnt offering which he hath offered.
And*p all the meat offering that is baken in the oven, and all that is dressed in the fryingpan, and in the pan, shall be the priest's that offereth it.
And*p every meat offering, mingled with oil, and dry, shall all the sons of Aaron have, one as much as another.
And*p this is the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which he shall offer unto the Lord.*s

If*p he offer it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour, fried.
Besides*p the cakes, he shall offer for his offering leavened bread with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace offerings.
And*p of it he shall offer one out of the whole oblation for an heave offering unto the Lord,*s and it shall be the priest's that sprinkleth the blood of the peace offerings.
And*p the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten the same day that it is offered; he shall not leave any of it until the morning.
But*p if the sacrifice of his offering be a vow, or a voluntary offering, it shall be eaten the same day that he offereth his sacrifice: and on the morrow also the remainder of it shall be eaten:
But*p the remainder of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burnt with fire.

And*p if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings be eaten at all on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto him that offereth it: it shall be an abomination, and the soul that eateth of it shall bear his iniquity.
And*p the flesh that toucheth any unclean thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire: and as for the flesh, all that be clean shall eat thereof.
But*p the soul that eateth of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, that pertain unto the Lord,*s having his uncleanness upon him, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.

Moreover*p the soul that shall touch any unclean thing, as the uncleanness of man, or any unclean beast, or any abominable unclean thing, and eat of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which pertain unto the Lord,*s even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak*p unto the children of Israel, saying, Ye shall eat no manner of fat, of ox, or of sheep, or of goat.
And*p the fat of the beast that dieth of itself, and the fat of that which is torn with beasts, may be used in any other use: but ye shall in no wise eat of it.
For*p whosoever eateth the fat of the beast, of which men offer an offering made by fire unto the Lord,*s even the soul that eateth it shall be cut off from his people.
Moreover*p ye shall eat no manner of blood, whether it be of fowl or of beast, in any of your dwellings.
Whatsoever*p soul it be that eateth any manner of blood, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak*p unto the children of Israel, saying, He that offereth the sacrifice of his peace offerings unto the Lord*s shall bring his oblation unto the Lord*s of the sacrifice of his peace offerings.
His*p own hands shall bring the offerings of the Lord*s made by fire, the fat with the breast, it shall he bring, that the breast may be waved for a wave offering before the Lord.*s
And*p the priest shall burn the fat upon the altar: but the breast shall be Aaron's and his sons'.
And*p the right shoulder shall ye give unto the priest for an heave offering of the sacrifices of your peace offerings.
He*p among the sons of Aaron, that offereth the blood of the peace offerings, and the fat, shall have the right shoulder for his part.

For*p the wave breast and the heave shoulder have I taken of the children of Israel from off the sacrifices of their peace offerings, and have given them unto Aaron the priest and unto his sons by a statute for ever from among the children of Israel.

This*p is the portion of the anointing of Aaron, and of the anointing of his sons, out of the offerings of the Lord*s made by fire, in the day when he presented them to minister unto the Lord*s in the priest's office;
Which*p the Lord*s commanded to be given them of the children of Israel, in the day that he anointed them, by a statute for ever throughout their generations.
This*p is the law of the burnt offering, of the meat offering, and of the sin offering, and of the trespass offering, and of the consecrations, and of the sacrifice of the peace offerings;
Which*p the Lord*s commanded Moses in mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their oblations unto the Lord,*s in the wilderness of Sinai.
Leviticus 8
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Take*p Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and a bullock for the sin offering, and two rams, and a basket of unleavened bread;
And*p gather thou all the congregation together unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p Moses did as the Lord*s commanded him; and the assembly was gathered together unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p Moses said unto the congregation, This is the thing which the Lord*s commanded to be done.
And*p Moses brought Aaron and his sons, and washed them with water.

And*p he put upon him the coat, and girded him with the girdle, and clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod upon him, and he girded him with the curious girdle of the ephod, and bound it unto him therewith.
And*p he put the breastplate upon him: also he put in the breastplate the Urim and the Thummim.
And*p he put the mitre upon his head; also upon the mitre, even upon his forefront, did he put the golden plate, the holy crown; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that was therein, and sanctified them.
And*p he sprinkled thereof upon the altar seven times, and anointed the altar and all his vessels, both the laver and his foot, to sanctify them.
And*p he poured of the anointing oil upon Aaron's head, and anointed him, to sanctify him.
And*p Moses brought Aaron's sons, and put coats upon them, and girded them with girdles, and put bonnets upon them; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he brought the bullock for the sin offering: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the bullock for the sin offering.

And*p he slew it; and Moses took the blood, and put it upon the horns of the altar round about with his finger, and purified the altar, and poured the blood at the bottom of the altar, and sanctified it, to make reconciliation upon it.
And*p he took all the fat that was upon the inwards, and the caul above the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and Moses burned it upon the altar.
But*p the bullock, and his hide, his flesh, and his dung, he burnt with fire without the camp; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he brought the ram for the burnt offering: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram.
And*p he killed it; and Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.
And*p he cut the ram into pieces; and Moses burnt the head, and the pieces, and the fat.

And*p he washed the inwards and the legs in water; and Moses burnt the whole ram upon the altar: it was a burnt sacrifice for a sweet savour, and an offering made by fire unto the Lord;*s as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p he brought the other ram, the ram of consecration: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram.
And*p he slew it; and Moses took of the blood of it, and put it upon the tip of Aaron's right ear, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.

And*p he brought Aaron's sons, and Moses put of the blood upon the tip of their right ear, and upon the thumbs of their right hands, and upon the great toes of their right feet: and Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.
And*p he took the fat, and the rump, and all the fat that was upon the inwards, and the caul above the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and the right shoulder:
And*p out of the basket of unleavened bread, that was before the Lord,*s he took one unleavened cake, and a cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, and put them on the fat, and upon the right shoulder:
And*p he put all upon Aaron's hands, and upon his sons' hands, and waved them for a wave offering before the Lord.*s
And*p Moses took them from off their hands, and burnt them on the altar upon the burnt offering: they were consecrations for a sweet savour: it is an offering made by fire unto the Lord.*s
And*p Moses took the breast, and waved it for a wave offering before the Lord:*s for of the ram of consecration it was Moses' part; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.

And*p Moses took of the anointing oil, and of the blood which was upon the altar, and sprinkled it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon his sons' garments with him; and sanctified Aaron, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons' garments with him.

And*p Moses said unto Aaron and to his sons, Boil the flesh at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: and there eat it with the bread that is in the basket of consecrations, as I commanded, saying, Aaron and his sons shall eat it.
And*p that which remaineth of the flesh and of the bread shall ye burn with fire.
And*p ye shall not go out of the door of the tabernacle of the congregation in seven days, until the days of your consecration be at an end: for seven days shall he consecrate you.
As*p he hath done this day, so the Lord*s hath commanded to do, to make an atonement for you.
Therefore*p shall ye abide at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation day and night seven days, and keep the charge of the Lord,*s that ye die not: for so I am commanded.
So*p Aaron and his sons did all things which the Lord*s commanded by the hand of Moses.
Leviticus 9
And*p it came to pass on the eighth day, that Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;
And*p he said unto Aaron, Take thee a young calf for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering, without blemish, and offer them before the Lord.*s
And*p unto the children of Israel thou shalt speak, saying, Take ye a kid of the goats for a sin offering; and a calf and a lamb, both of the first year, without blemish, for a burnt offering;
Also*p a bullock and a ram for peace offerings, to sacrifice before the Lord;*s and a meat offering mingled with oil: for to day the Lord*s will appear unto you.
And*p they brought that which Moses commanded before the tabernacle of the congregation: and all the congregation drew near and stood before the Lord.*s
And*p Moses said, This is the thing which the Lord*s commanded that ye should do: and the glory of the Lord*s shall appear unto you.

And*p Moses said unto Aaron, Go unto the altar, and offer thy sin offering, and thy burnt offering, and make an atonement for thyself, and for the people: and offer the offering of the people, and make an atonement for them; as the Lord*s commanded.
Aaron*p therefore went unto the altar, and slew the calf of the sin offering, which was for himself.
And*p the sons of Aaron brought the blood unto him: and he dipped his finger in the blood, and put it upon the horns of the altar, and poured out the blood at the bottom of the altar:
But*p the fat, and the kidneys, and the caul above the liver of the sin offering, he burnt upon the altar; as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
And*p the flesh and the hide he burnt with fire without the camp.
And*p he slew the burnt offering; and Aaron's sons presented unto him the blood, which he sprinkled round about upon the altar.
And*p they presented the burnt offering unto him, with the pieces thereof, and the head: and he burnt them upon the altar.
And*p he did wash the inwards and the legs, and burnt them upon the burnt offering on the altar.
And*p he brought the people's offering, and took the goat, which was the sin offering for the people, and slew it, and offered it for sin, as the first.
And*p he brought the burnt offering, and offered it according to the manner.
And*p he brought the meat offering, and took an handful thereof, and burnt it upon the altar, beside the burnt sacrifice of the morning.
He*p slew also the bullock and the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings, which was for the people: and Aaron's sons presented unto him the blood, which he sprinkled upon the altar round about,
And*p the fat of the bullock and of the ram, the rump, and that which covereth the inwards, and the kidneys, and the caul above the liver:
And*p they put the fat upon the breasts, and he burnt the fat upon the altar:
And*p the breasts and the right shoulder Aaron waved for a wave offering before the Lord;*s as Moses commanded.
And*p Aaron lifted up his hand toward the people, and blessed them, and came down from offering of the sin offering, and the burnt offering, and peace offerings.
And*p Moses and Aaron went into the tabernacle of the congregation, and came out, and blessed the people: and the glory of the Lord*s appeared unto all the people.
And*p there came a fire out from before the Lord,*s and consumed upon the altar the burnt offering and the fat: which when all the people saw, they shouted, and fell on their faces.
Leviticus 10
And*p Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, took either of them his censer, and put fire therein, and put incense thereon, and offered strange fire before the Lord,*s which he commanded them not.
And*p there went out fire from the Lord,*s and devoured them, and they died before the Lord.*s
Then*p Moses said unto Aaron, This is it that the Lord*s spake, saying, I will be sanctified in them that come nigh me, and before all the people I will be glorified. And Aaron held his peace.
And*p Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said unto them, Come near, carry your brethren from before the sanctuary out of the camp.
So*p they went near, and carried them in their coats out of the camp; as Moses had said.

And*p Moses said unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons, Uncover not your heads, neither rend your clothes; lest ye die, and lest wrath come upon all the people: but let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the Lord*s hath kindled.
And*p ye shall not go out from the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: for the anointing oil of the Lord*s is upon you. And they did according to the word of Moses.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Aaron, saying,
Do*p not drink wine nor strong drink, thou, nor thy sons with thee, when ye go into the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations:
And*p that ye may put difference between holy and unholy, and between unclean and clean;
And*p that ye may teach the children of Israel all the statutes which the Lord*s hath spoken unto them by the hand of Moses.

And*p Moses spake unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons that were left, Take the meat offering that remaineth of the offerings of the Lord*s made by fire, and eat it without leaven beside the altar: for it is most holy:
And*p ye shall eat it in the holy place, because it is thy due, and thy sons' due, of the sacrifices of the Lord*s made by fire: for so I am commanded.

And*p the wave breast and heave shoulder shall ye eat in a clean place; thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee: for they be thy due, and thy sons' due, which are given out of the sacrifices of peace offerings of the children of Israel.

The*p heave shoulder and the wave breast shall they bring with the offerings made by fire of the fat, to wave it for a wave offering before the Lord;*s and it shall be thine, and thy sons' with thee, by a statute for ever; as the Lord*s hath commanded.
And*p Moses diligently sought the goat of the sin offering, and, behold, it was burnt: and he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron which were left alive, saying,

Wherefore*p have ye not eaten the sin offering in the holy place, seeing it is most holy, and God hath given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the Lord?*s
Behold,*p the blood of it was not brought in within the holy place: ye should indeed have eaten it in the holy place, as I commanded.

And*p Aaron said unto Moses, Behold, this day have they offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before the Lord;*s and such things have befallen me: and if I had eaten the sin offering to day, should it have been accepted in the sight of the Lord?*s
And*p when Moses heard that, he was content.
Leviticus 11
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying unto them,
Speak*p unto the children of Israel, saying, These are the beasts which ye shall eat among all the beasts that are on the earth.
Whatsoever*p parteth the hoof, and is clovenfooted, and cheweth the cud, among the beasts, that shall ye eat.
Nevertheless*p these shall ye not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the hoof: as the camel, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he is unclean unto you.
And*p the coney, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he is unclean unto you.
And*p the hare, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he is unclean unto you.
And*p the swine, though he divide the hoof, and be clovenfooted, yet he cheweth not the cud; he is unclean to you.
Of*p their flesh shall ye not eat, and their carcase shall ye not touch; they are unclean to you.
These*p shall ye eat of all that are in the waters: whatsoever hath fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, them shall ye eat.
And*p all that have not fins and scales in the seas, and in the rivers, of all that move in the waters, and of any living thing which is in the waters, they shall be an abomination unto you:
They*p shall be even an abomination unto you; ye shall not eat of their flesh, but ye shall have their carcases in abomination.
Whatsoever*p hath no fins nor scales in the waters, that shall be an abomination unto you.
And*p these are they which ye shall have in abomination among the fowls; they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, and the ossifrage, and the ospray,
And*p the vulture, and the kite after his kind;
Every*p raven after his kind;
And*p the owl, and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind,
And*p the little owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl,
And*p the swan, and the pelican, and the gier eagle,
And*p the stork, the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.
All*p fowls that creep, going upon all four, shall be an abomination unto you.
Yet*p these may ye eat of every flying creeping thing that goeth upon all four, which have legs above their feet, to leap withal upon the earth;
Even*p these of them ye may eat; the locust after his kind, and the bald locust after his kind, and the beetle after his kind, and the grasshopper after his kind.
But*p all other flying creeping things, which have four feet, shall be an abomination unto you.
And*p for these ye shall be unclean: whosoever toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean until the even.
And*p whosoever beareth ought of the carcase of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.
The*p carcases of every beast which divideth the hoof, and is not clovenfooted, nor cheweth the cud, are unclean unto you: every one that toucheth them shall be unclean.
And*p whatsoever goeth upon his paws, among all manner of beasts that go on all four, those are unclean unto you: whoso toucheth their carcase shall be unclean until the even.
And*p he that beareth the carcase of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: they are unclean unto you.
These*p also shall be unclean unto you among the creeping things that creep upon the earth; the weasel, and the mouse, and the tortoise after his kind,
And*p the ferret, and the chameleon, and the lizard, and the snail, and the mole.
These*p are unclean to you among all that creep: whosoever doth touch them, when they be dead, shall be unclean until the even.

And*p upon whatsoever any of them, when they are dead, doth fall, it shall be unclean; whether it be any vessel of wood, or raiment, or skin, or sack, whatsoever vessel it be, wherein any work is done, it must be put into water, and it shall be unclean until the even; so it shall be cleansed.
And*p every earthen vessel, whereinto any of them falleth, whatsoever is in it shall be unclean; and ye shall break it.
Of*p all meat which may be eaten, that on which such water cometh shall be unclean: and all drink that may be drunk in every such vessel shall be unclean.
And*p every thing whereupon any part of their carcase falleth shall be unclean; whether it be oven, or ranges for pots, they shall be broken down: for they are unclean, and shall be unclean unto you.
Nevertheless*p a fountain or pit, wherein there is plenty of water, shall be clean: but that which toucheth their carcase shall be unclean.
And*p if any part of their carcase fall upon any sowing seed which is to be sown, it shall be clean.
But*p if any water be put upon the seed, and any part of their carcase fall thereon, it shall be unclean unto you.
And*p if any beast, of which ye may eat, die; he that toucheth the carcase thereof shall be unclean until the even.
And*p he that eateth of the carcase of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: he also that beareth the carcase of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.
And*p every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth shall be an abomination; it shall not be eaten.

Whatsoever*p goeth upon the belly, and whatsoever goeth upon all four, or whatsoever hath more feet among all creeping things that creep upon the earth, them ye shall not eat; for they are an abomination.
Ye*p shall not make yourselves abominable with any creeping thing that creepeth, neither shall ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should be defiled thereby.

For*p I am the Lord*s your God: ye shall therefore sanctify yourselves, and ye shall be holy; for I am holy: neither shall ye defile yourselves with any manner of creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
For*p I am the Lord*s that bringeth you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: ye shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.
This*p is the law of the beasts, and of the fowl, and of every living creature that moveth in the waters, and of every creature that creepeth upon the earth:
To*p make a difference between the unclean and the clean, and between the beast that may be eaten and the beast that may not be eaten.
Leviticus 12
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,

Speak*p unto the children of Israel, saying, If a woman have conceived seed, and born a man child: then she shall be unclean seven days; according to the days of the separation for her infirmity shall she be unclean.
And*p in the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.
And*p she shall then continue in the blood of her purifying three and thirty days; she shall touch no hallowed thing, nor come into the sanctuary, until the days of her purifying be fulfilled.
But*p if she bear a maid child, then she shall be unclean two weeks, as in her separation: and she shall continue in the blood of her purifying threescore and six days.

And*p when the days of her purifying are fulfilled, for a son, or for a daughter, she shall bring a lamb of the first year for a burnt offering, and a young pigeon, or a turtledove, for a sin offering, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, unto the priest:
Who*p shall offer it before the Lord,*s and make an atonement for her; and she shall be cleansed from the issue of her blood. This is the law for her that hath born a male or a female.

And*p if she be not able to bring a lamb, then she shall bring two turtles, or two young pigeons; the one for the burnt offering, and the other for a sin offering: and the priest shall make an atonement for her, and she shall be clean.
Leviticus 13
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses and Aaron, saying,

When*p a man shall have in the skin of his flesh a rising, a scab, or bright spot, and it be in the skin of his flesh like the plague of leprosy; then he shall be brought unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests:

And*p the priest shall look on the plague in the skin of the flesh: and when the hair in the plague is turned white, and the plague in sight be deeper than the skin of his flesh, it is a plague of leprosy: and the priest shall look on him, and pronounce him unclean.

If*p the bright spot be white in the skin of his flesh, and in sight be not deeper than the skin, and the hair thereof be not turned white; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague seven days:
And*p the priest shall look on him the seventh day: and, behold, if the plague in his sight be at a stay, and the plague spread not in the skin; then the priest shall shut him up seven days more:

And*p the priest shall look on him again the seventh day: and, behold, if the plague be somewhat dark, and the plague spread not in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean: it is but a scab: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
But*p if the scab spread much abroad in the skin, after that he hath been seen of the priest for his cleansing, he shall be seen of the priest again:
And*p if the priest see that, behold, the scab spreadeth in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a leprosy.
When*p the plague of leprosy is in a man, then he shall be brought unto the priest;
And*p the priest shall see him: and, behold, if the rising be white in the skin, and it have turned the hair white, and there be quick raw flesh in the rising;
It*p is an old leprosy in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean, and shall not shut him up: for he is unclean.
And*p if a leprosy break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy cover all the skin of him that hath the plague from his head even to his foot, wheresoever the priest looketh;
Then*p the priest shall consider: and, behold, if the leprosy have covered all his flesh, he shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: it is all turned white: he is clean.
But*p when raw flesh appeareth in him, he shall be unclean.
And*p the priest shall see the raw flesh, and pronounce him to be unclean: for the raw flesh is unclean: it is a leprosy.
Or*p if the raw flesh turn again, and be changed unto white, he shall come unto the priest;
And*p the priest shall see him: and, behold, if the plague be turned into white; then the priest shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: he is clean.
The*p flesh also, in which, even in the skin thereof, was a boil, and is healed,
And*p in the place of the boil there be a white rising, or a bright spot, white, and somewhat reddish, and it be shewed to the priest;

And*p if, when the priest seeth it, behold, it be in sight lower than the skin, and the hair thereof be turned white; the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague of leprosy broken out of the boil.
But*p if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hairs therein, and if it be not lower than the skin, but be somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:
And*p if it spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague.
But*p if the bright spot stay in his place, and spread not, it is a burning boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
Or*p if there be any flesh, in the skin whereof there is a hot burning, and the quick flesh that burneth have a white bright spot, somewhat reddish, or white;

Then*p the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, if the hair in the bright spot be turned white, and it be in sight deeper than the skin; it is a leprosy broken out of the burning: wherefore the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.
But*p if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hair in the bright spot, and it be no lower than the other skin, but be somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:
And*p the priest shall look upon him the seventh day: and if it be spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.

And*p if the bright spot stay in his place, and spread not in the skin, but it be somewhat dark; it is a rising of the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him clean: for it is an inflammation of the burning.
If*p a man or woman have a plague upon the head or the beard;

Then*p the priest shall see the plague: and, behold, if it be in sight deeper than the skin; and there be in it a yellow thin hair; then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a dry scall, even a leprosy upon the head or beard.

And*p if the priest look on the plague of the scall, and, behold, it be not in sight deeper than the skin, and that there is no black hair in it; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague of the scall seven days:
And*p in the seventh day the priest shall look on the plague: and, behold, if the scall spread not, and there be in it no yellow hair, and the scall be not in sight deeper than the skin;
He*p shall be shaven, but the scall shall he not shave; and the priest shall shut up him that hath the scall seven days more:

And*p in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall: and, behold, if the scall be not spread in the skin, nor be in sight deeper than the skin; then the priest shall pronounce him clean: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
But*p if the scall spread much in the skin after his cleansing;
Then*p the priest shall look on him: and, behold, if the scall be spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for yellow hair; he is unclean.
But*p if the scall be in his sight at a stay, and that there is black hair grown up therein; the scall is healed, he is clean: and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
If*p a man also or a woman have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, even white bright spots;
Then*p the priest shall look: and, behold, if the bright spots in the skin of their flesh be darkish white; it is a freckled spot that groweth in the skin; he is clean.
And*p the man whose hair is fallen off his head, he is bald; yet is he clean.
And*p he that hath his hair fallen off from the part of his head toward his face, he is forehead bald: yet is he clean.
And*p if there be in the bald head, or bald forehead, a white reddish sore; it is a leprosy sprung up in his bald head, or his bald forehead.
Then*p the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, if the rising of the sore be white reddish in his bald head, or in his bald forehead, as the leprosy appeareth in the skin of the flesh;
He*p is a leprous man, he is unclean: the priest shall pronounce him utterly unclean; his plague is in his head.
And*p the leper in whom the plague is, his clothes shall be rent, and his head bare, and he shall put a covering upon his upper lip, and shall cry, Unclean, unclean.
All*p the days wherein the plague shall be in him he shall be defiled; he is unclean: he shall dwell alone; without the camp shall his habitation be.
The*p garment also that the plague of leprosy is in, whether it be a woollen garment, or a linen garment;
Whether*p it be in the warp, or woof; of linen, or of woollen; whether in a skin, or in any thing made of skin;
And*p if the plague be greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it is a plague of leprosy, and shall be shewed unto the priest:
And*p the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut up it that hath the plague seven days:

And*p he shall look on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague be spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in a skin, or in any work that is made of skin; the plague is a fretting leprosy; it is unclean.
He*p shall therefore burn that garment, whether warp or woof, in woollen or in linen, or any thing of skin, wherein the plague is: for it is a fretting leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire.
And*p if the priest shall look, and, behold, the plague be not spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin;
Then*p the priest shall command that they wash the thing wherein the plague is, and he shall shut it up seven days more:

And*p the priest shall look on the plague, after that it is washed: and, behold, if the plague have not changed his colour, and the plague be not spread; it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it is fret inward, whether it be bare within or without.
And*p if the priest look, and, behold, the plague be somewhat dark after the washing of it; then he shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof:
And*p if it appear still in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it is a spreading plague: thou shalt burn that wherein the plague is with fire.
And*p the garment, either warp, or woof, or whatsoever thing of skin it be, which thou shalt wash, if the plague be departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and shall be clean.
This*p is the law of the plague of leprosy in a garment of woollen or linen, either in the warp, or woof, or any thing of skins, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean.
Leviticus 14
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
This*p shall be the law of the leper in the day of his cleansing: He shall be brought unto the priest:
And*p the priest shall go forth out of the camp; and the priest shall look, and, behold, if the plague of leprosy be healed in the leper;
Then*p shall the priest command to take for him that is to be cleansed two birds alive and clean, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop:
And*p the priest shall command that one of the birds be killed in an earthen vessel over running water:

As*p for the living bird, he shall take it, and the cedar wood, and the scarlet, and the hyssop, and shall dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water:
And*p he shall sprinkle upon him that is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let the living bird loose into the open field.

And*p he that is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, and shave off all his hair, and wash himself in water, that he may be clean: and after that he shall come into the camp, and shall tarry abroad out of his tent seven days.

But*p it shall be on the seventh day, that he shall shave all his hair off his head and his beard and his eyebrows, even all his hair he shall shave off: and he shall wash his clothes, also he shall wash his flesh in water, and he shall be clean.

And*p on the eighth day he shall take two he lambs without blemish, and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish, and three tenth deals of fine flour for a meat offering, mingled with oil, and one log of oil.
And*p the priest that maketh him clean shall present the man that is to be made clean, and those things, before the Lord,*s at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:
And*p the priest shall take one he lamb, and offer him for a trespass offering, and the log of oil, and wave them for a wave offering before the Lord:*s

And*p he shall slay the lamb in the place where he shall kill the sin offering and the burnt offering, in the holy place: for as the sin offering is the priest's, so is the trespass offering: it is most holy:

And*p the priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering, and the priest shall put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot:
And*p the priest shall take some of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand:
And*p the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in his left hand, and shall sprinkle of the oil with his finger seven times before the Lord:*s

And*p of the rest of the oil that is in his hand shall the priest put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the blood of the trespass offering:
And*p the remnant of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shall pour upon the head of him that is to be cleansed: and the priest shall make an atonement for him before the Lord.*s
And*p the priest shall offer the sin offering, and make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed from his uncleanness; and afterward he shall kill the burnt offering:
And*p the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the meat offering upon the altar: and the priest shall make an atonement for him, and he shall be clean.

And*p if he be poor, and cannot get so much; then he shall take one lamb for a trespass offering to be waved, to make an atonement for him, and one tenth deal of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering, and a log of oil;
And*p two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, such as he is able to get; and the one shall be a sin offering, and the other a burnt offering.
And*p he shall bring them on the eighth day for his cleansing unto the priest, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, before the Lord.*s
And*p the priest shall take the lamb of the trespass offering, and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before the Lord:*s

And*p he shall kill the lamb of the trespass offering, and the priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot:
And*p the priest shall pour of the oil into the palm of his own left hand:
And*p the priest shall sprinkle with his right finger some of the oil that is in his left hand seven times before the Lord:*s

And*p the priest shall put of the oil that is in his hand upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the place of the blood of the trespass offering:
And*p the rest of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed, to make an atonement for him before the Lord.*s
And*p he shall offer the one of the turtledoves, or of the young pigeons, such as he can get;

Even*p such as he is able to get, the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, with the meat offering: and the priest shall make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed before the Lord.*s
This*p is the law of him in whom is the plague of leprosy, whose hand is not able to get that which pertaineth to his cleansing.
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
When*p ye be come into the land of Canaan, which I give to you for a possession, and I put the plague of leprosy in a house of the land of your possession;
And*p he that owneth the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, It seemeth to me there is as it were a plague in the house:

Then*p the priest shall command that they empty the house, before the priest go into it to see the plague, that all that is in the house be not made unclean: and afterward the priest shall go in to see the house:
And*p he shall look on the plague, and, behold, if the plague be in the walls of the house with hollow strakes, greenish or reddish, which in sight are lower than the wall;
Then*p the priest shall go out of the house to the door of the house, and shut up the house seven days:
And*p the priest shall come again the seventh day, and shall look: and, behold, if the plague be spread in the walls of the house;
Then*p the priest shall command that they take away the stones in which the plague is, and they shall cast them into an unclean place without the city:
And*p he shall cause the house to be scraped within round about, and they shall pour out the dust that they scrape off without the city into an unclean place:
And*p they shall take other stones, and put them in the place of those stones; and he shall take other mortar, and shall plaster the house.
And*p if the plague come again, and break out in the house, after that he hath taken away the stones, and after he hath scraped the house, and after it is plastered;
Then*p the priest shall come and look, and, behold, if the plague be spread in the house, it is a fretting leprosy in the house: it is unclean.
And*p he shall break down the house, the stones of it, and the timber thereof, and all the mortar of the house; and he shall carry them forth out of the city into an unclean place.
Moreover*p he that goeth into the house all the while that it is shut up shall be unclean until the even.
And*p he that lieth in the house shall wash his clothes; and he that eateth in the house shall wash his clothes.

And*p if the priest shall come in, and look upon it, and, behold, the plague hath not spread in the house, after the house was plastered: then the priest shall pronounce the house clean, because the plague is healed.
And*p he shall take to cleanse the house two birds, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop:
And*p he shall kill the one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water:
And*p he shall take the cedar wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times:
And*p he shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, and with the running water, and with the living bird, and with the cedar wood, and with the hyssop, and with the scarlet:
But*p he shall let go the living bird out of the city into the open fields, and make an atonement for the house: and it shall be clean.
This*p is the law for all manner of plague of leprosy, and scall,
And*p for the leprosy of a garment, and of a house,
And*p for a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot:
To*p teach when it is unclean, and when it is clean: this is the law of leprosy.
Leviticus 15
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying,
Speak*p unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When any man hath a running issue out of his flesh, because of his issue he is unclean.
And*p this shall be his uncleanness in his issue: whether his flesh run with his issue, or his flesh be stopped from his issue, it is his uncleanness.
Every*p bed, whereon he lieth that hath the issue, is unclean: and every thing, whereon he sitteth, shall be unclean.
And*p whosoever toucheth his bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
And*p he that sitteth on any thing whereon he sat that hath the issue shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
And*p he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the issue shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
And*p if he that hath the issue spit upon him that is clean; then he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
And*p what saddle soever he rideth upon that hath the issue shall be unclean.

And*p whosoever toucheth any thing that was under him shall be unclean until the even: and he that beareth any of those things shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
And*p whomsoever he toucheth that hath the issue, and hath not rinsed his hands in water, he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
And*p the vessel of earth, that he toucheth which hath the issue, shall be broken: and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.

And*p when he that hath an issue is cleansed of his issue; then he shall number to himself seven days for his cleansing, and wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in running water, and shall be clean.
And*p on the eighth day he shall take to him two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, and come before the Lord*s unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and give them unto the priest:
And*p the priest shall offer them, the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for him before the Lord*s for his issue.
And*p if any man's seed of copulation go out from him, then he shall wash all his flesh in water, and be unclean until the even.
And*p every garment, and every skin, whereon is the seed of copulation, shall be washed with water, and be unclean until the even.
The*p woman also with whom man shall lie with seed of copulation, they shall both bathe themselves in water, and be unclean until the even.
And*p if a woman have an issue, and her issue in her flesh be blood, she shall be put apart seven days: and whosoever toucheth her shall be unclean until the even.
And*p every thing that she lieth upon in her separation shall be unclean: every thing also that she sitteth upon shall be unclean.
And*p whosoever toucheth her bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
And*p whosoever toucheth any thing that she sat upon shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
And*p if it be on her bed, or on any thing whereon she sitteth, when he toucheth it, he shall be unclean until the even.
And*p if any man lie with her at all, and her flowers be upon him, he shall be unclean seven days; and all the bed whereon he lieth shall be unclean.

And*p if a woman have an issue of her blood many days out of the time of her separation, or if it run beyond the time of her separation; all the days of the issue of her uncleanness shall be as the days of her separation: she shall be unclean.
Every*p bed whereon she lieth all the days of her issue shall be unto her as the bed of her separation: and whatsoever she sitteth upon shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her separation.
And*p whosoever toucheth those things shall be unclean, and shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
But*p if she be cleansed of her issue, then she shall number to herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.
And*p on the eighth day she shall take unto her two turtles, or two young pigeons, and bring them unto the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p the priest shall offer the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for her before the Lord*s for the issue of her uncleanness.
Thus*p shall ye separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness; that they die not in their uncleanness, when they defile my tabernacle that is among them.
This*p is the law of him that hath an issue, and of him whose seed goeth from him, and is defiled therewith;
And*p of her that is sick of her flowers, and of him that hath an issue, of the man, and of the woman, and of him that lieth with her that is unclean.
Leviticus 16
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they offered before the Lord,*s and died;

And*p the Lord*s said unto Moses, Speak unto Aaron thy brother, that he come not at all times into the holy place within the veil before the mercy seat, which is upon the ark; that he die not: for I will appear in the cloud upon the mercy seat.
Thus*p shall Aaron come into the holy place: with a young bullock for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering.

He*p shall put on the holy linen coat, and he shall have the linen breeches upon his flesh, and shall be girded with a linen girdle, and with the linen mitre shall he be attired: these are holy garments; therefore shall he wash his flesh in water, and so put them on.
And*p he shall take of the congregation of the children of Israel two kids of the goats for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt offering.
And*p Aaron shall offer his bullock of the sin offering, which is for himself, and make an atonement for himself, and for his house.
And*p he shall take the two goats, and present them before the Lord*s at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And*p Aaron shall cast lots upon the two goats; one lot for the Lord,*s and the other lot for the scapegoat.
And*p Aaron shall bring the goat upon which the Lord's*s lot fell, and offer him for a sin offering.
But*p the goat, on which the lot fell to be the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before the Lord,*s to make an atonement with him, and to let him go for a scapegoat into the wilderness.

And*p Aaron shall bring the bullock of the sin offering, which is for himself, and shall make an atonement for himself, and for his house, and shall kill the bullock of the sin offering which is for himself:
And*p he shall take a censer full of burning coals of fire from off the altar before the Lord,*s and his hands full of sweet incense beaten small, and bring it within the veil:
And*p he shall put the incense upon the fire before the Lord,*s that the cloud of the incense may cover the mercy seat that is upon the testimony, that he die not:
And*p he shall take of the blood of the bullock, and sprinkle it with his finger upon the mercy seat eastward; and before the mercy seat shall he sprinkle of the blood with his finger seven times.

Then*p shall he kill the goat of the sin offering, that is for the people, and bring his blood within the veil, and do with that blood as he did with the blood of the bullock, and sprinkle it upon the mercy seat, and before the mercy seat:

And*p he shall make an atonement for the holy place, because of the uncleanness of the children of Israel, and because of their transgressions in all their sins: and so shall he do for the tabernacle of the congregation, that remaineth among them in the midst of their uncleanness.

And*p there shall be no man in the tabernacle of the congregation when he goeth in to make an atonement in the holy place, until he come out, and have made an atonement for himself, and for his household, and for all the congregation of Israel.

And*p he shall go out unto the altar that is before the Lord,*s and make an atonement for it; and shall take of the blood of the bullock, and of the blood of the goat, and put it upon the horns of the altar round about.
And*p he shall sprinkle of the blood upon it with his finger seven times, and cleanse it, and hallow it from the uncleanness of the children of Israel.
And*p when he hath made an end of reconciling the holy place, and the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar, he shall bring the live goat:

And*p Aaron shall lay both his hands upon the head of the live goat, and confess over him all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions in all their sins, putting them upon the head of the goat, and shall send him away by the hand of a fit man into the wilderness:
And*p the goat shall bear upon him all their iniquities unto a land not inhabited: and he shall let go the goat in the wilderness.
And*p Aaron shall come into the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall put off the linen garments, which he put on when he went into the holy place, and shall leave them there:

And*p he shall wash his flesh with water in the holy place, and put on his garments, and come forth, and offer his burnt offering, and the burnt offering of the people, and make an atonement for himself, and for the people.
And*p the fat of the sin offering shall he burn upon the altar.
And*p he that let go the goat for the scapegoat shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward come into the camp.

And*p the bullock for the sin offering, and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the holy place, shall one carry forth without the camp; and they shall burn in the fire their skins, and their flesh, and their dung.
And*p he that burneth them shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.

And*p this shall be a statute for ever unto you: that in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, ye shall afflict your souls, and do no work at all, whether it be one of your own country, or a stranger that sojourneth among you:
For*p on that day shall the priest make an atonement for you, to cleanse you, that ye may be clean from all your sins before the Lord.*s
It*p shall be a sabbath of rest unto you, and ye shall afflict your souls, by a statute for ever.

And*p the priest, whom he shall anoint, and whom he shall consecrate to minister in the priest's office in his father's stead, shall make the atonement, and shall put on the linen clothes, even the holy garments:

And*p he shall make an atonement for the holy sanctuary, and he shall make an atonement for the tabernacle of the congregation, and for the altar, and he shall make an atonement for the priests, and for all the people of the congregation.
And*p this shall be an everlasting statute unto you, to make an atonement for the children of Israel for all their sins once a year. And he did as the Lord*s commanded Moses.
Leviticus 17
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak*p unto Aaron, and unto his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them; This is the thing which the Lord*s hath commanded, saying,
What*p man soever there be of the house of Israel, that killeth an ox, or lamb, or goat, in the camp, or that killeth it out of the camp,

And*p bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer an offering unto the Lord*s before the tabernacle of the Lord;*s blood shall be imputed unto that man; he hath shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people:

To*p the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they offer in the open field, even that they may bring them unto the Lord,*s unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, unto the priest, and offer them for peace offerings unto the Lord.*s
And*p the priest shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar of the Lord*s at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and burn the fat for a sweet savour unto the Lord.*s
And*p they shall no more offer their sacrifices unto devils, after whom they have gone a whoring. This shall be a statute for ever unto them throughout their generations.
And*p thou shalt say unto them, Whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers which sojourn among you, that offereth a burnt offering or sacrifice,
And*p bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer it unto the Lord;*s even that man shall be cut off from among his people.

And*p whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, that eateth any manner of blood; I will even set my face against that soul that eateth blood, and will cut him off from among his people.
For*p the life of the flesh is in the blood: and I have given it to you upon the altar to make an atonement for your souls: for it is the blood that maketh an atonement for the soul.
Therefore*p I said unto the children of Israel, No soul of you shall eat blood, neither shall any stranger that sojourneth among you eat blood.

And*p whatsoever man there be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, which hunteth and catcheth any beast or fowl that may be eaten; he shall even pour out the blood thereof, and cover it with dust.

For*p it is the life of all flesh; the blood of it is for the life thereof: therefore I said unto the children of Israel, Ye shall eat the blood of no manner of flesh: for the life of all flesh is the blood thereof: whosoever eateth it shall be cut off.

And*p every soul that eateth that which died of itself, or that which was torn with beasts, whether it be one of your own country, or a stranger, he shall both wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even: then shall he be clean.
But*p if he wash them not, nor bathe his flesh; then he shall bear his iniquity.
Leviticus 18
And*p the Lord*s spake unto Moses, saying,
